overview: Risk management is a key business activity that impacts the full range of organisational activities and functional areas across the enterprise. This subject surveys a spectrum of business risks from operational to strategic risks. It provides a foundation in enterprise risk management principles, tools and techniques such as risk scenario planning.
ilo: Analyse the need for risk management and explain how risk management influences business decisions
Describe and evaluate risks of different types
Interpret and analyse business situations utilising a risk management framework to assess impact on the enterprise and recommend an appropriate response
generic_skills: Interpretation and analysis of real-world cases

Inherent requirements (core participatio.content: Further details on how to seek academic adjustments can be found on the Student Equity and Disability Support website:http://services.unimelb.edu.au/student-equity/home

assessment.brief: Group project (normally in groups of 5 students)

date_times.contact_hours: 36 hours, comprising of three 3 hour seminars per week
